Posts.Content: hutspa wrote: hello everyone, its been awhile since my last update...my mom is now 2 years & 3 months surviving stage 4 bc...she has been on xeloda for 2 years and gets a zometa injection once a month (she has liver & bone mets)....she has taken 14 trips in the last year (my dad retired early so he could spend quality time with her) she is 61 & still fighting...original diag. was Jan 2003 with stage 2b then reoccurance in July 2008...we have gone to Vegas, NY, DC, Orlando (many times), & she even took a 2 week train trip with my dad to Maryland (our old home)...XELODA has worked great for her, I hope this gives hope to all of you starting this drug :) unfortunately her blood levels have spiked and she had scans Thursday, we meet with the doc this thursday, her nurse (my dear friend) said he will probably put her on faslodex next...lets hope this works as well as Xeloda....FOR THOSE OF YOU who have taken xeloda and moved to the next round of treatment what were you put on ????  Thank You all <3 always have HOPE :) Dana Dx 1/3/2003, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIIA, 5/13 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: my mom is still fighting but question whats next hutspa hutspa

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2010 06:56AM hutspa wrote: Thank You Both <3 the scan will tell us alot, she had one 5 months ago which was stable but ever since the blood work has elevated...ctc count has ticked from 0 to 9 but just jumped to 50, her tm was 17 but jumped to 34, her alk phos was 80 but jumped to 150, etc...that is why she did the new scans thursday....her blood has always been a great indicator but doc said its still probably an early progession unless scans show something new...she had the standard chemo treatment 8 yrs ago when 1st diagnosed, cytokin, adymiacin, taxotere + radiation...then 5 yrs free (tomaxifen) then only xeloda & zometa at reoccurance 2 yrs ago...been holding steady until now...we are hopeful, doctor said he has alot of options & tricks up his sleeve....i will definately look into arimidex & cisplatin b4 apt on thursday so i can have my questions ready incase those are his choices...THANK YOU so much for sharing your info & i will keep you posted :) xoxoxoxoxoxo
Posts.Title: my mom is still fighting but question whats next hutspa hutspa

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2008 08:28AM hutspa wrote: michelle.....hang in there....your mom needs you strong.....easy to say, but hard to do i know.... ive been 2 er with my mom and the doctors there are just focusing on stabilizing patients, i would highly suggest calling her doctor....most doctors have nurses or doctors on call that can help with your questions....you may also want to consider calling gemzar's manufacter and they maybe can answer some questions....try to keep her as comfortable as possible....hopefully this is just a bump in the road and she will have many better days ahead..... xoxoxoxo     dana
Posts.Title: Update on my mom ejohn LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2008 07:30AM hutspa wrote: my mom is using udderly smooth....she was using it on her hands and feet as a preventitive but her face started to dry up like you explained....she now is using it on her face and it working GREAT...just keep it out of eyes....good luck :)

Posts.Title: Trip Neg Recurrance....warning long post! wayover20 wayover20

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2008 05:33PM hutspa wrote: just a shot in the dark here, but if this was my moms situation i think that i would try calling the cancer society, susan g koman, and or other cancer groups and ask them....then i would also try to call big hospitals / doctors and plead my case for any advice.....for example mofit, anderson, ucla, etc....if you make a 100 calls or send a hundred emails it only takes one person to care and help you out.....plead your case some people, even though not getting there co-pay, still care about people and hopefully will help you out....we see my moms oncologist thursday and i will surely ask hes opinion for you....hang in there and keep doing what you are doing for your mom.....im right there with you and i hope we can find you some answers.....xoxoxoxo   dana
Posts.Title: rare symptom, HELP! shengyue527 LuAnnH

Posts.Content: hutspa wrote: hello everyone.....what a whirlwin the last few weeks have been... my mom started her chemo thursday she is receiving 3500 mg of xeloda everyday for 2 weeks then she gets a week off......then every three weeks she get abraxane 470 mg......then every month she gets 4mg of zometa..... so far not so bad....she is fatigued but not much more than she was before starting chemo, she is experiencing the metallic taste, and her feet are extremely cold at night....we have her taking b6 and using udderly smooth to help offset the foot/hands thing.... i asked her oncologist the reasons behind the dosages (esp xeloda) he stated it was based on her blood levels and organ functions and since her organ functions were good and blood levels ok (except high cal & high alk phos) he was hitting her on the high end and can adjust down as needed..... tolarable is a good word....for now....lets just hope it all works.....luv to you all...xoxoxoxo dana Dx 1/3/2003, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIIA, 5/13 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: my mom's update hutspa mimi1030

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2008 06:30PM hutspa wrote: thanks for the folic acid tip....i will definately look into it :)
Posts.Title: my mom's update hutspa mimi1030

Posts.Content: hutspa wrote: hello...thank you for taking the time to read this... my mom was diagnosed with breast cancer jan 2003...she was 53 then....1cm but in 5 of 13 lymphnodes were positive...lumpectomy, chemo, and radiation and she is now 5 years out... she goes every 6months for mamos and bloodwork...all has been fine (her tumor maker 27/29 fluctuates but has gome from the low of 9 to a high now of 21....still within normal range the doc says)...all counts on bloodwork from oncologist have been good... she recently went to primary and they found high blood calcium levels....she has been fatigued, aches and pains, headaches, etc (but nothing central to one location or spot)...of course now im concerned about the cancer return into bones my question is....would other blood abnormalities present themself if her cancer has come back or is just the calcium enough....she has had a ct and mri and both are normal but is scheduled for a spinal tap monday... thanks for any input :) Dx 1/3/2003, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIIA, 5/13 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: high blood calcium vs other results hutspa Joviangeldeb

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2008 08:07AM hutspa wrote: THANK YOU EVERYONE !!!! everything keeps getting weirder...her tongue will not move left we saw a neurologist yesterday and he will be doing a spinal tap monday....tongue issue does not seem to be result of any cancer...we will get the parathyroid blood results back hopefully today...i called her oncologist and they are gonna do a pet scan....whats scarry is the nurse said if she has high calcium but pth is normal there is cause for concern :(  as most of you are we are VERY ANXIOUS and the waiting game is killer....have any of you had large fluxuations in your tumor marker counts?
Posts.Title: high blood calcium vs other results hutspa Joviangeldeb

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 07:05PM hutspa wrote: thanks everyone for your replies....i wish this board was not needed but im grateful u all are here thanks michelle :) im glad ur mom is doing better.....this sux !!!! her parathyroid came back normal :(... spinal tap and re-test cal levels tomorrow....i am also looking at the fact she had a reclast injection in nov and hoping that these are some side effects...reclast seems a bit scary but also seems to cause hypo not hypercalcemia...when you read about high calcium levels in the blood it gets really scary :( luv 2 u all
Posts.Title: high blood calcium vs other results hutspa Joviangeldeb

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2008 09:59AM hutspa wrote: hey tracy...my mom struggled so much with heartburn and gerd, since her first round of treatment 5 years ago it has always been an issue even though she wasnt on chemo for 5 years....it seems,  like neurathopy,  for her,  it lingers for years after treatment...now on chemo again it has increased....she used "nexium" the first round but is now on " pantoprazole" it is generic so its cheap...it is working for her but it is perscription one you get a better doc or see the senior doc ask for this or something similar....there are meds out there to help you !!!!!! xoxoxoxo    keep us posted      dana
Posts.Title: taxol is horrid Tracy1964 AusAla

Posts.Content: hutspa wrote: ok, my mom is asking and im not sure how to answer and we dont see doc for two more weeks so i figured you extremely informed an intelligent ladies would know... are lessions and tumors the same thing??? her pet/cat stated multiple lessions throughout her bones but then mentioned tumors in liver....what is the difference or are they the same thing......thank you :) xoxoxo dana Dx 1/3/2003, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIIA, 5/13 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: silly question im sure, but ???? hutspa hutspa

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2008 01:58PM hutspa wrote: when my mom had her chemo, she had the same metallic taste and smells made her gag... what worked for her was.....cherry popsicles (tasted good and felt good to swallow) & easy on tummy, any flavor would prob work...she also tolerated carnation instant breaksfast well, it also helps with essential nutrients....jello ice cream and pudding may be other options....she tended to tolerate more liquid form things than solid...ive prob forgotten some things but ill ask her later and may add a few ideas for you....good luck xoxoxoxo
Posts.Title: Cisplatin Side Effects Help Needed susan_02143 susan_02143

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2008 09:25AM hutspa wrote: what kind of treatment was she on?....i know chemo sounds very scarry but the new drugs now are not nearly as toxic as they were years ago...they also have wonderful drugs that can counter-act the side effects including fatigue.....once you know what type of meds they are going to give her post it here and all these amazing women will give you encouragement, knowledge and love....they all have wonderful tips for coping with side-effects....luv 2 u both... dana

Posts.Title: Thank Heaven For Little Girls...LOL. britbaby katie11

Posts.Content: hutspa wrote: hello every1 i hope you are having a good day !!! my mom had her 3rd round of treatment 2day (cant believe we r already 2 months into this) and her doc said her bloodwork was REMARKABLE :)  wow, that was a nice thing to hear....her alkaline phosphate went from 838 to 595.....her calcium went from 10.6 to a NORMAL 8.5....... and her ca 27/29 tumer marker went from 81 to 45   ....all indications that her treatment plan was working.....he had to lower her dose of xeloda due to hand/foot to 2000mg but he said in no way does this effect the outcome....fatigue has been her biggest complaint but she is now drinking a diet dr pepper a day and since she normally does not intake caffeine she gets a big burst of energy....whatever works, right? ps..... my mom is now telling anyone that asks her "is there anything i can do for you or anything that you need" her response is YES, please vote for Obama......lol....im so glad shes getting spunky again Dx 1/3/2003, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIIA, 5/13 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: stable -- YEAH! kimmytoo Poppy

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2008 11:36PM hutspa wrote: hi greta.... my mom had to have her dose of xeloda lowered due to the problems you describe....she was on 2 cycles of 3500mg...the doc gave her 2 weeks off so the side-effects would go away and resumed her at 2000mg a day.....we just started the lower dose so hopefully she will not have such a terrible time....HOWEVER...doc also said that the side effects are a result that it is working !!!!! and her bloodwork confirms that, today we received notice that her alk, cal & tumor marker droped :) all signs that these shi##y drugs are working......im sorry you are having this problem but xeloda is probably kickn cancer butt....ask your doc about lower dosing....xoxoxoxo dana
Posts.Title: another Xeloda question greta saint

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2008 03:36PM hutspa wrote: my mom had an allergic reaction to taxol 5 years ago....paramedics were called, etc...same scarry as# sh#t you went through.....she reacted about 10 min after drip started so they just gave her taxotere the next time....guess they are same family of drug but with different bases...they will watch you carefuly next time so dont be scarred and if you react they will stop it right away and put you on something else....so many options....sooooooo glad you are ok now and have such a wonderful hubby by your side.....xoxoxo

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2008 12:57PM hutspa wrote: hello....my mom had the hand foot syndrom from the xeloda as well.....the doctor lowered the dose from 3500 to 2000 and that got rid of the hand foot issues....the xeloda is working good for her recent ct scans have shown improvement...your may may want to try the lower dose first before pushing that drug out.....it has done good for alot of people.....good luck with everything, i know the decissions are hard.....xoxxoxoxoxoxoxoxo      dana

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2008 09:17AM hutspa wrote: well, we are about 2 hours south and have an AMAZING group of docs and surgeons...we are in cape coral ft. myers....surgeon is HIGHLY recommended "JACOB GOLDBERGER" 239-274-7600.......we also LOVE our onchologist "THOMAS TEUFEL" 239-772-3544...... my mom has been battling cancer for 20 years and she has had the same set of doctors all these years....they are wonderful caring brilliant people....let me know if there is anything i can do for you....hopefully you will get some good recommendations closer to home but if you dont, they may be worth the drive :)

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2008 02:36PM hutspa wrote: please call me if you want to talk !!!! private message me for my number....i OFTEN feel exactly like you discribe....my mom has had a recurrence and in 2 months ive lost 25 pounds been prescribed meds and taken off of them, seen 2 shrinks and have lost my "normal" life, so believe me i know what you r going through...my mom has bone and liver mets but as you will read from many of the women on this board that "death" is not a certatanty and should "NOT" be considered an option....there are great meds now that can help control this shitty disease....i find that when i can actually talk to people it makes me feel better....im sure you have a great family and friends but it can help to talk to someone who is walking in similar shoes.....IM HERE FOR YOU  if you need me.................    LUV Dana
